result.execSummary:
The defendant Deanna Monique Hoffman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deanna Monique Hoffman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deanna Monique Hoffman was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Deanna Monique Hoffman was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Green County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: with any sentence being served

miscConds.notes: Costs, surcharges & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent.  Failure to pay will be one day in jail for every $50 or part thereof that remains unpaid with Huber consecutive to any other time being served (so long as DE reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free).
Defendant shall undergo treatment and counseling as agent deems appropriate.

Deanna Monique Hoffman, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
  Plea Questionaire filed.    No Contest plea entered counts 1,2.    Court advises defendant of rights.  Elements stated.  Factual basis found.
  Defendant advised of post conviction relief.

Deanna Monique Hoffman, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Deanna Monique Hoffman, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor.
Jeffrey Duane Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney.
  Court advises defendant of rights.  Defendant given complaint. Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
  Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.
  Return cash bond to poster.

Violation: Misd. Bail Jumping - 2 cts.; Possession of THC; Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.  Iss. Agency: Green County Sheriff's Dept.  May not possess any intoxicants except for employment purposes and may not consume any intoxicants.   May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician presently treating the defendant.  May not posssess or use any drug paraphernalia.  May not enter establishments that sell intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold except for employment purposes.
